Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Wingbrace Digital Engineering Team is charged with identifying, developing, and applying new technologies that can address the Government's most challenging software and systems engineering problems.

Wingbrace is growing again !! We are looking for an additional Data Analyst to join our team.

Wingbrace offers 3 weeks’ Vacation,Sick time, Health, Dental and Vision. A 401k plan with 4% match, 10 holidays, 2 floating holidays. A bonus program,Tele health / Mental health coverage to name a few of our benefits.

This is an opportunity for a Data Analyst who is highly motivated, innovative, and self-directed. This position provides challenging opportunities to apply and expand one’s Data, andanalytical skills.

This opportunity will be client facing, and collaborative with a lot of growth. You will present to the highest levels of the division and be asked your opinion. You will work with an experienced team who will mentor, coach, and share best practices.

The ideal person for this position has an exceptional eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a solid understanding of popular data analysis tools. He/she will work closely with product owners, and end users across various lines of business to understand the objectives of our clients and prioritize any requirements.

Day To Day Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to leverage and grow your Data, Communication and Engineering expertise by:


Working with several of our data sets and developing respective reports/visualizations
Develop and analyze scenarios that tie in all mission areas.
Generation of analytical modeling solutions to assess performance, identifying technology gaps, creating technology roadmaps, developing requirements, and specifying the operational benefits of current and future concepts based on client approved scenarios.
Support development and briefing of data packages that provide analysis results to inform government decision-makers.
Review and report all findings to appropriate parties. Explain the testing of data and the ability to import and process anything confidential according to the guidelines given.
Create reports for the customer and internal users that can provide clarity trends as well as areas for improvement
Support the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements as well as initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Develops, inspects, and transforms, the data to raise productivity, improve decision making, and gain competitive advantage.
Preparing reports for executive leadership that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Collaborating with programmers, engineers, and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance. Maintains analytical systems, verifies the accuracy of the data, and acts as liaison with other stake holders


Skills/Education/Certification


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management, Business, a quantitative field or equivalent.
Three (3) years or more of a related experience


Required:


Must be a US citizen. With the ability to obtain a security clearance. Before applying, please read about the qualifications for obtaining a security clearance
Programming languages for quantitative analyses (ex. Mathematica, Python, R)
Technical writing (e.g., data definitions) experience
Experience using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts
Experience building dashboards, visualizations, and presentations
Ability to understand business needs and relay into easy to understand, non-technical language


Beneficial:


Have a minimum secretUS DoD clearance
Deep Data Profiling and Data Modeling Experience
Analyzing data for Air Force/DoD programs


Wingbrace LLC is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or another protected characteristic. We value each individual and empower our people to fearlessly drive lasting change.

To Learn more about Wingbrace careers go to www.wingbrace.com - Career Page (applytojob.com)

About Wingbrace

Wingbrace (www.wingbrace.com) is a software and technical services company focused on the delivery of solutions for our clients. We produce software, develop architectures, code, and operate modeling and simulation systems, and build decision support systems -- rapidly and effectively.

We consider successful outcomes as our metric, and our client engagements benefit from a depth of understanding of organizational, cultural and mission issues, yielding speed and integration of critical capabilities.

Service-disabled veteran owned, our culture is collaboration and performance with a commitment to diversity and the values it conveys. We actively support a variety of open and secure environments. We have prime and subcontractor relationships with the government and large corporate partners.

We are developers.Our ethos arises from the discipline of the deliverable and our efficiency from an unburdened approach to using the best tools and products for our client. Our compass is innovation, leading us to exceptional results delivered to our clients.

Wingbrace LLC is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or another protected characteristic.  We value each individual and empower our people to fearlessly drive lasting change.

If you need assistance email us at info@wingbrace.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Paladin Consulting is currently hiring a Data Analyst to join our team working onsite at our client's office located in Framingham, MA.

We work with companies that offer environments for our employees to contribute, learn, and advance their career. We treat you like you are part of the family.

Job Title: Data Analyst
Work Location: Framingham, MA
Duration: 4 Month Contract
Education/Experience Required: High School Diploma/GED or equivalent work experience; Bachelor's Degree preferred plus 3-6 years of professional experience providing analytics, statistics, consulting or other related fields

Job Description:
The Data Analyst, People Analytics will focus on managing human capital projects which will include the delivery of relevant and meaningful insights to enable strategic business decisions. This position is responsible for proactively identifying areas of focus, providing analysis and insight on key human capital topics to support the objectives of the business and helping to increase the effectiveness of the entire organization. Additionally, this position will be responsible for working with Talent Advisors and management to increase their understanding of key workforce metrics and how to use the data to drive the business.

Responsibilities :

Project Management: Responsible for managing projects related to human capital metrics and workforce planning, ensuring projects are delivered on time and according to business requirements. This role will require analyzing and interpreting data using various analytical and visualization tool, along with providing insights and recommendations that are impactful and drive results. Will manage multiple projects at once, working with stakeholders at all levels.

Analytics: Using historical and predictive analytics along with benchmarking, this role will conduct in-depth analyses on key workforce metrics. Monitors competitive trends and utilizes that information appropriately in analysis. Proactively identifies areas of opportunity and develops recommendations for future considerations. Provides expertise and guidance to business partners on how to best utilize workforce data to drive results.

Consulting: Builds relationships across the organization, providing ongoing consultation and serving as strategic business partner to leaders. Conducts ongoing needs assessment with Talent Advisors in the areas of workforce metrics, projects and benchmark studies.

Skills & Qualifications :
3-6 years of professional experience providing analytics, statistics, consulting or other related fields
Experience in providing advisory services/consulting in workforce planning or people analytics space
Project management experience around implementing analytics/technology solutions through consulting with various business stakeholder
Proven experience in using Tableau or other data visualization software to build and present insights through visual analysis
Experience with analytics software (e.g., R, Python, Alteryx) and/or SQL language would be advantageous

Other Skills (e.g. specialized training, language proficiency, functional expertise etc.)

Outstanding data analysis and quantitative skills, including attention to detail and ability to manage various data points to achieve a common goal (people knowledge, internal data, external tools).
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects within tight time constraints.
Excellent communication skills. Skilled in building relationships with business partners and proactively assessing the needs of the business, bringing forth opportunities before they become problems.

For more information or to view other opportunities, visit us at www.paladininc.com.

Paladin Consulting is an EEOC employer.

Analytics: Using historical and predictive analytics along with benchmarking, this role will conduct in-depth analyses on key workforce metrics. Monitors competitive trends and utilizes that information appropriately in analysis. Proactively identifies areas of opportunity and develops recommendations for future considerations. Provides expertise and guidance to business partners on how to best utilize workforce data to drive results.

Consulting: Builds relationships across the organization, providing ongoing consultation and serving as strategic business partner to leaders. Conducts ongoing needs assessment with Talent Advisors in the areas of workforce metrics, projects and benchmark studies.

Skills & Qualifications :
  • 3-6 years of professional experience providing analytics, statistics, consulting or other related fields
  • Experience in providing advisory services/consulting in workforce planning or people analytics space
  • Project management experience around implementing analytics/technology solutions through consulting with various business stakeholder
  • Proven experience in using Tableau or other data visualization software to build and present insights through visual analysis
  • Experience with analytics software (e.g., R, Python, Alteryx) and/or SQL language would be advantageous

Other Skills (e.g. specialized training, language proficiency, functional expertise etc.)

  • Outstanding data analysis and quantitative skills, including attention to detail and ability to manage various data points to achieve a common goal (people knowledge, internal data, external tools).
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects within tight time constraints.
  • Excellent communication skills. Skilled in building relationships with business partners and proactively assessing the needs of the business, bringing forth opportunities before they become problems.
For more information or to view other opportunities, visit us at www.paladininc.com.

Paladin Consulting is an EEOC employer.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.

Job Description

Sr. Data Analyst, Business Operations

Location: Waltham, MA (2 days per week)

Get To Know The Team:

SS&C Intralinks is seeking a talented and motivated Sr. Business Operations Analyst to join our Product Development team. You will report to the Senior Director of Product Development Operations and work cross-functionally with our Product, FP&A, Sales Operations and Change Management teams to help deliver actionable insights to our product management and senior leadership teams.

Why You Will Love It Here!


Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model & Business Casual Dress Code
Your Future: 401k Matching Program, Professional Development Reimbursement
Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays
Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave
Diversity & Inclusion: Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity
Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, including SS&C University
Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more!


What You Will Get To Do:


Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau and other BI solutions
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and provide actionable recommendations based on findings
Develop ROI model for new product initiatives
Help develop and maintain data dictionary and other documentation for data models, processes, and reporting standards to ensure knowledge sharing and consistency
Serve as a subject matter expert for all cross functional stakeholders needing timely and relevant data for their analyses
Monitor data quality and resolve any discrepancies or inconsistencies in collaboration with data engineering teams


What You Will Bring:


Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience required
3-5 years of experience as a BI Analyst or Business Operations Manager, with a track record of designing and delivering impactful reporting solutions
Experience working in a SaaS business
Expert level in using Tableau to create dashboards and visualizations
Expert level Excel and SQL skills for data querying and manipulation
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and data modeling principles
Strong data optimization skills and experience working with large data sets
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality


Thank you for your interest in SS&C! To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at www.ssctech.com/careers.

Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

Title: Academy Data Analyst - Part-time, Remote
Description:
Academy Data Analyst - Part-time

Boston Bolts Overview

The Boston Bolts possess more than 38 years of experience in bringing the world’s game to communities across Massachusetts. In addition to overseeing youth teams across a full developmental pathway, the Boston Bolts participate in the USL, the largest and fastest-growing professional soccer organization in North America, with a team in the USL League Two.

The Boston Bolts are a growing organization that looks for team members to grow with it. The internship is hands-on, allowing successful candidates the opportunity to learn in a professional environment and experience a dynamic organization first-hand. The Bolts are searching for a hardworking, self-starter who is motivated to make contributions to the organization’s continuous growth and seeks a career in sports management.

Position Description

The Academy Data Analyst will help design and implement programs to improve the club’s ability to evaluate team performance and elevate the Bolts experience for players. In conjunction with MLS Next Academy and Data Analytics staff, this individual will assist in the development of post-match analysis to help prepare players to perform at their peak. The Academy Data Analyst is a stipend, part-time position with an expected weekly commitment of approximately 10-15 hours per week.

Position Timeline

This position will run from September 4 to June 13th.

Primary Responsibilities


Help implement Boston Bolts coaching philosophy
Contribute to workflows and perform in-depth analysis on diverse data sets from MLS Next & NAL games
Develop and implement advanced performance analytics strategies to support the Elite Pathway teams in achieving peak performance
Integrate interdisciplinary performance data from various sources to create holistic and actionable insights
Create compelling visualizations and reports that communicate complex data in a clear, impactful manner to non-technical stakeholders
Liaise with players and staff on player development progress in line with the Individual Development Plan process


Qualifications


Quick learner who can function in the fast-paced environment mandated by the sports industry
Ability to successfully manage several projects at once and prioritize assignments
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Prior soccer experience strongly preferred


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job#: 2037146

Job Description:

Junior Data Analyst with a foundational understanding of SQL and data visualization tools. Eager to apply analytical skills to real-world data problems, this individual is proficient in querying databases using SQL to extract, clean, and manipulate data. With a working knowledge of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI, they are capable of creating clear and informative charts and dashboards that communicate key insights to stakeholders. Demonstrates strong attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and a willingness to learn and adapt in a dynamic work environment. Ready to contribute to data-driven decision-making and support the analytics team in delivering actionable insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BOSTON, Massachusetts - Hybrid

2 days a week remote

3+ years of experience

3+ years experience with Salesforce

3+ years of experience with PowerBI, Tableau or Handshake

Experience with Python or R and SQL

This is a mix of a Data / Business Analyst position

Description

Job Description

Data Analyst, Feld Center for Career and Alumni Engagement

Position Summary

We are seeking an experienced and motivated Associate Director of Data Analytics for a temporary position in the Feld Center for Career and Alumni Engagement. This individual will be responsible for serving as primary liaison to Questrom IT during the buildout and implementation of a new and evolving Salesforce CRM. In addition, the Associate Director will provide strategic insight into opportunities for dashboard development and data collection and synthesis to improve data-driven decision making related to career development events, activities and student outcomes.

Key Responsibilities

Database Administration:


Serve as the primary liaison to Questrom IT and Salesforce consultants during the buildout the Feld Center instance of the Salesforce CRM to incorporate alumni engagement and action learning
Work with the Questrom IT team and Salesforce consultants to facilitate integrations and plug-ins with Salesforce and LinkedIn, Handshake, Outlook, etc.
Develop and document standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data management and administration workflows.
Provide training and support for staff on effective use of Salesforce for career services, industry engagement, alumni engagement, and action learning activities.


Data Collection And Synthesis


Identify opportunities to optimize data collection and synthesis related to career services, industry engagement, alumni engagement, and action learning; including employer and alumni participation, student engagement, and data mapping to resulting internship and job outcomes
Analyze industry and alumni engagement metrics to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement; suggest new metrics as data allows and as relevant to decision-making needs
Collaborate with Questrom Decision Support (QRO to support data collection efforts related to national surveys and rankings


Key Skills


Expertise in Salesforce development, design, integration, and training
Experience in conducting database training sessions and developing database training materials
Experience or ability to develop proficiency with platforms including Handshake and PowerBI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders, including staff, students, employers, alumni, and faculty.
Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Business, Information Technology, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within higher education or career services.
Demonstrated experience with Salesforce administration and data management.
Proficiency in PowerBI, Handshake, and other relevant software and tools.
R, Python, SQL, database management tools

Title: Analyst, Commercial Analytics
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each others strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.

We are looking for an Analyst to support KAYAK’s team in North America! This is a position working closely with our partner's data, so attention to detail and strong analytical skills are required. You should feel comfortable working with large amounts of data, be self-motivated and proactive in analyzing, investigating and prioritizing information found across multiple datasets and sources. You'll be working with all departments within the company and will be building cross-functional relationships. The ability to adapt to a fast paced environment is key for this position.

This position is required to work from our Cambridge, MA office at least 3 days per week.

In this role, you will:



Support the NORAM commercial team by fulfilling all partners' reporting and internal analytics requests and by communicating data and information in useful insights and easily consumable reports
Be responsible for accurately estimating the delivery of our Advertising campaigns
Monitor daily performance of all verticals for NORAM: be on top of traffic changes, shifts in business metrics, product updates and A/B tests
Improve internal reporting by developing new dashboards and data visualizations
Investigate discrepancies in key business metrics among different reporting and data sources
Define the needed critical metrics in conjunction with the rest of the business team



Please apply if you have:



BA/BS degree required, preferably in Business, Economics, IT, or similar
Clear ability analyzing data and developing reporting. Travel industry and online experience a plus
Understanding of databases, with at least 2 years hands-on SQL experience
Excellent MS Excel, PowerPoint, and G-Suite
High level of data integrity, focus on accuracy, and operational precision
Familiarity with reporting systems and BI visualization tools. Knowledge of Tableau, Cognos, Salesforce a plus
Familiarity with GTM or other tag management systems a plus
Fluent in English, written and spoken, is a must. Any additional language a plus
Results-oriented, with high attention to detail, strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to optimally liaise and connect with other internal KAYAK teams, also across different offices
Ability to balance multiple requests at the same time and prioritize their own work



Benefits & Perks:



4 weeks paid vacation
Day off on your birthday
Generous retirement plans
Awesome health, dental and vision insurance plans
Flexible Spending Accounts
Headspace subscription
No Meeting Fridays
Drinks, coffee, snacks, games etc
Catered lunches three times a week
Flexible hours
Regular team events/excursions
Universal paid parental leave



Diversity and Inclusion

We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more creative ideas, products, and better outcomes for our team members. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Codeworks is an IT Services firm headquartered in SE Wisconsin, known for our strong commitment to quality and for our direct client relationships.

We’re looking for an outstanding Data Analyst who has knowledge and passion about data in investment management domain and is committed to innovation and continuous improvement. As a part of the Data Operations Team, you will work in constructing and supporting a data first ecosystem and governance process. Partner closely with data owners, stewards and custodians in mapping out the data ecosystem and defining the appropriate governance model for each data domain.

Responsibilities

As a part of the Data Operations Team, you will work in constructing and supporting a data first ecosystem and governance process.

Partner closely with data owners, stewards and custodians in mapping out the data ecosystem and defining the appropriate governance model for each data domain.

Required Qualifications

Data experience; doesn't need to be an analyst or engineer but someone who has a history of solving data problems.

Investment management industry experience

Proficiency in SQL.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us Stride Funding is a venture-backed, mission-driven startup transforming access to education and career pathways. We are revolutionizing the way employers attract and retain critical talent, while simultaneously tackling the student debt crisis. (Yep, we think BIG.) Our innovative platform meaningfully connects employers, educational institutions, and diverse talent to drive mutual benefit—using accessible education financing as the thread. We like to think of ourselves as more than a fintech; we’re a catalyst for economic mobility. A Forbes Fintech 50 company, portfolio company of SHRM (Society of Human Resource Management — the largest HR organization out there!) and recipient of “Startup of the Year” by StartUp Boston, Stride is driven by our commitment to social impact and innovation. We are reshaping the future of the workforce one opportunity at a time. Join us on our journey to give power to learners and unlock fulfilling careers that drive positive change in their communities and beyond. What we need We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst to drive our reporting product and data-driven decision making as we scale our product to help tens of thousands more students and partner with dozens more alternative education partners, financing hundreds of millions of dollars of loans and other financial products. The Senior Data Analyst will play a critical role in shaping our data infrastructure, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights to support strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate is exceptionally strong at SQL and Python, and has experience working with dbt or equivalent for data transformation. At Stride we run a DevOps culture where the engineers and analysts have full ownership of the code they write & the infrastructure on which it runs. Candidates should be enthused about data management best-practices and well-versed in storytelling with data. We are looking for someone excited to learn many facets of our business, from top-of-funnel applicant reporting to loan repayment optimization recommendations, and achieving tremendous personal growth with us along the way! What you'll do


Deeply understand of our finance data models, flow of funds, disbursements, etc. and working with other departments to build deep domain expertise and unlock those departments data
Utilize SQL to build, test, and maintain data models and transformations within the data warehouse, ensuring that models are optimized for performance and are clearly documented for consumption by others
Develop and maintain internal and customer-facing dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and other business metrics
Perform complex data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions across the organization; this will require deep partnership with many subject matter experts
Collaborate with stakeholders and data engineers to implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data
Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data technologies and methodologies
Mentor junior analysts and provide guidance on best practices in data analysis, ETL, and data modeling



What you'll need


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a equivalent bootcamp or up skilling program
5+ years of experience in data analysis, ETL, and data modeling in a production environment
Expertise in SQL and proficiency with relational databases (ie PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server)Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and pipeline development
Experience with data visualization tools (ie Tableau, Power BI, Preset) to create user-friendly reports and dashboards, ensuring that visualizations are clear, actionable and well-documented
Excellent problem solving and analytical skillsStrong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with stakeholders both synchronously and asynchronously



What we give in return


What We Give In Return
Competitive cash and equity compensation
Health benefits (health, vision & dental), 401k
Commuter benefits
Flexible PTO policy
Opportunities to grow and perform in a fast-paced environment alongside a stellar team



If you are a highly driven individual with a passion for technology, and you thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you! Join us in revolutionizing the workforce solution industry and making a meaningful impact on businesses worldwide. Apply now to be a part of our growing team! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives and talents. Stride is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We embrace diversity and are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

SENIOR DATA ANALYST, MIT Technology Review (TR) , to support TR’s analytic needs by owning data analysis and reporting and providing actionable insights and recommendations to several teams, including consumer marketing, events, editorial, and sales. Will build strong analytics systems using technically robust methods, collaborate with stakeholders to develop a course of action based on insights derived from data and trends, and make recommendations based on a strategic understanding of TR’s mission and commercial and editorial objectives.

Full Job Description Available Here .

Job Requirements

REQUIRED : bachelor’s degree in a relevant field; two years’ experience working with analysis and reporting tools and advanced web analytics methodologies (e.g., experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys, and market research); expert-level proficiency with the primary components of TR’s stack--Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Google Tag Manager; proficiency with online media and/or e-commerce environments; advanced-level Excel skills; ability to apply understanding of complex web ecosystems and best practices; expertise with customer data platforms and other business intelligence tools; experience writing and tuning SQL queries and comfort with the tools and languages used to gather and manipulate data; experience integrating third-party APIs (data sources) into a business intelligence stack; experience measuring the success of digital marketing efforts, (e.g. social, SEM/PPC, and SEO campaigns); understanding of core website technologies (HTML, CSS, JS); excellent organizational, problem-solving, and verbal and written communication skills; attention to detail; and ability to interact effectively with end-users and technical resources at all levels, work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team, and use sound judgment to identify and/or escalate issues. PREFERRED : Python, R, etc., experience; and experience in a subscription-style business. Job #24293-7

8/7/24
Show more

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
Position: Consumer Insight Analyst (NO THIRD PARTIES PLEASE)




Location: Boston area, Fulltime, Onsite




Employment Type: 3-6 months contract with potential for permanent




The Consumer Insight Analyst is on the front-line supporting the growing demands for consumer insight critical in our mission of developing 5 star products and services. Working in conjunction with Marketing, Quality and Consumer Services teams, this is a “hands-on” role, conducting, executing, and managing quantitative and qualitative research projects.




Please note that this is NOT a Data Analyst role. The ideal candidate for this will have experience working directly with consumers and/or customers in IHUTs (in home usage testing), focus groups, surveys, interviews etc. This is a very visible role in the company so excellent presentation and communication skills are a must.




Essential Functions:

In collaboration with Marketing, develop research plans and conduct qualitative and quantitative customer research for trends, insights, and new product development.
Assist in the development, management and execution of research plans and within established budget guidelines.
Create, maintain and issue project plans to project team members.
Establish appropriate processes & and methodologies for customer research projects including research partner collaboration as required.
Conduct research to link product development projects to customer and market needs.
Translate feedback, including latent needs and dissatisfaction, into innovation recommendations.
Identify potential unmet customer needs that form the basis for new product/feature offerings.
Collaborate and plan customer research strategies and manage internal and external resources to successfully deliver on plans.




Desired Skills and Experience

Some IHUT (in home usage testing) or Consumer Product Testing experience required at this time
The ideal candidate will have 1-7 years' Market Research experience, be naturally inquisitive, have strong project management skills, hands on research experience and demonstrate strong strategic and critical thinking skills. Some travel will be required.
Builds understanding and trust with others by meeting commitments
Identifies the needs & expectations of others (personal & business) and acts upon them.
Develops a solid network through all levels of the organization related to internal & external customers.
Creates mutually acceptable solutions
Provides prompt, efficient and personalized service to both internal & external customers
Leverages strong organizational and analytical skills to synthesize information from various sources focusing on relevancy and impact opportunity.
Effectively represents/balances the customer perspective when providing insight and recommendations to improve customer experience
Thrives in a hands-on, dynamic, agile environment.
Effectively manages shifting priorities, resources. Understands that not all paths are defined and leverages his/ her experience to create” and add value.
Demonstrates and evokes creative and innovative thinking
Demonstrates empathy and patience and adapts style to his/her audience.
​Effectively collaborates with Insight analyst counterparts to develop and publish a comprehensive understanding of consumer wants/needs.

Education & Experience:

Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree with a focus on Marketing, Finance, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or other applicable quantitative discipline.
1-7 years of research experience in qualitative and quantitative custom research
Exposure to the CPG industry preferred.
Creative problem solver while working with established budget.
Highly analytical, familiarity with statistical modeling and analysis.
Strong communication and presentation and PC skills,
Exceptional influencing skills.
The ideal candidate will be naturally inquisitive and command strong writing skills.
Data analysis and synthesis.
Familiar with statistical techniques and ability to explain results in a clear manner.
Report and Presentation Development.
Translate complex data sets into easily digested and understood formats to identify and understand customer needs and uses data for new product ideas and benefits.
Preferred, but not required: training and experience on moderating focus groups and one-on-one interviewing




Our client is ready to interview and hire immediately!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are looking for a Tableau-savvy Data Analyst to translate complex data into insightful visuals and interactive dashboards for strategic decision-making.

Responsibilities


Develop and maintain Tableau reporting dashboards.
Interpret data, identify trends, and provide business insights.
Develop business intelligence visualizations.
Collaborate with team to implement data-driven solutions.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in reporting.


Qualifications


Degree in a related field.
Experience as a Data Analyst with expertise in Tableau.
Proficient in SQL, Excel, and other analytical tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills with ability to present data in a user-friendly format.


Requirements


Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst in the Service industry
Proficiency in using Atlassian Jira for project management
Experience in Database management and EO/IR systems
Familiarity with Gap Analysis and ability to conduct it effectively
Proficiency in Informatica for data integration services
Experience with AB Testing for product development
Knowledge of Agile Scrum methodology for project management
Understanding of Business Process Functions for effective analysis
Ability to create comprehensive Business Requirement Documents
Design skills for visualizing data and creating models
Proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and business intelligence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Fully remote in the USA

Job Overview

The Data Analyst will work under the direction of a Psychometrician using specifications to write and execute programs to perform psychometric analysis, scoring, and technical reporting using large datasets from large-scale assessments. This position requires proficiency and experience in working in a large-scale summative assessment environment where quality assurance, complex data sets, timely execution of tasks, and documentation of code are expected competencies.

Job Responsibilities


Maintains, updates, and operates existing code and develops new code as needed for review required for projects.
Develops rationale in programs to obtain required parameters to ensure data quality.
Applies given formulas to obtain required statistics for various types of psychometric data.
Maintains written documentation of all programming procedures and file structures for each project.
Assists with QC of data analysis results, applying prescribed criteria, and reporting questionable results.
Communicates concerns/insights to the project psychometrician.


Job Requirements


Advanced degree in statistics, mathematics, or a related field.
1+ years of statistical analysis experience. 1 year of psychometric programming experience with a testing company is preferred.
Must be proficient in R programming.
Experience with Winsteps and/or IRTPRO is preferred
Experience with R Markdown a plus.
Must be willing to continuously update knowledge and skills using new software applications available for test data analysis and efficiency enhancement.


Why Work With Us?

When you work with Cambium Assessment, you’ll be helping to design and build inspiring solutions that make a real impact on the online testing industry, as well as the educators and students we support.

Our Ground Breaking Work Includes


Advanced computer-adaptive algorithms
Mobile support of user interfaces
Learning management systems with social media features
Universally accessible user interfaces
Machine scorable items


In the 2021–2022 school year, we delivered more than 100 million online tests, successfully supported peak testing volumes exceeding 1.3 million simultaneous test takers, while ensuring an average response time of less than a tenth of a second. We have the most advanced features of any online testing system, and we continue to push boundaries to improve student performance measurement and enabling educators with actionable insights to drive better overall educational outcomes for our students. To learn more about our organization and the exciting work we do, visit www.cambiumassessment.com

An Equal Opportunity Employer

We are dedicated to fostering a culture that celebrates unique backgrounds, ideas, and experiences. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

Title: HR Data Analyst, Talent
Description:
Are you ready to build America’s clean energy future with the team that will deliver? Form Energy is an American energy technology and manufacturing company. We are pioneering a new class of iron-air batteries to enable our electric grid to run on renewable, reliable, and affordable energy, every day of the year.

Form Energy has been recognized by TIME as “One of the Best Inventions of 2023” for its battery technology and by MIT Technology Review as a “Top Climate Tech Company to Watch”. We are making rapid progress on our mission of delivering energy storage for a better world, and are growing just as rapidly to meet demand. Our team has more than doubled in size in the past year, and continues to expand every day. We have signed contracts with leading electric utilities across the United States. Pilot production of our iron-air batteries has already begun, and later this year, production will take off to high volumes at our new factory in West Virginia.

Working for Form Energy is more than just a job, it’s a chance to be part of something extraordinary. And right now might be the most exciting moment in the company’s history to join. We are assembling a team of some of the most talented and motivated individuals across the country. Driven by our core values of humanity, excellence, and creativity, our team is determined to deliver on our mission and transform the energy landscape for the better.

Feeling energized to make a meaningful impact on the world? Then keep reading - you’ve come to the right place.

Role Description

Form Energy's talent function is a strategic partner to the business, implementing workforce strategies that attract, deploy & retain diverse and skilled talent. We are seeking a dynamic and analytical HR Data Analyst to join our Human Resources team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming our talent acquisition, talent management, and other people-related functions through insightful data analytics, storytelling, and the development of robust data dashboards. This role requires a unique blend of data expertise, business acumen, and the ability to translate complex data into compelling narratives that drive actionable insights.

Applicants must be in the eastern timezone with access to a Form Energy location.

What You'll Do


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets related to talent acquisition, talent management, employee engagement, performance, and other HR metrics.
Identify key trends, patterns, and insights to support strategic decision-making.
Perform predictive analytics to anticipate future trends and provide actionable recommendations.
Develop and maintain interactive data dashboards that provide real-time insights and reporting for HR and business leaders.
Create compelling data-driven stories that communicate insights and recommendations effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Implement data governance best practices to ensure high-quality and reliable data.
Partner with HR leaders and business units to understand their needs and provide customized analytical solutions.
Work closely with talent acquisition, talent management, and other HR teams to support their analytics needs.
Train and support HR team members in using data tools and interpreting analytics.
Support the optimization of Ashby ATS & Analytics platform.
Support and analyze the impact of various talent programs and initiatives.


What You'll Bring


Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of people analytics experience with experience in applicant tracking systems, HRIS tools and other people database technologies
Advanced excel skills and experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, etc.);
Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and data governance and accuracy
Analytical and problem-solving skills to draw appropriate conclusions from data
Strong verbal communication skills in order to explain and present data visually in a clear, compelling manner.
Proven ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information in a discreet manner
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment


Applications will be accepted until the job is filled.

Humanity is a cornerstone of Form Energy’s culture, and we make sure our compensation and benefits reflect that. Form Energy offers competitive salaries, stock options, and a holistic benefits package to ensure all employees have what they need to thrive while working here.

When it comes to you and your family’s health, we cover 100% of medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees - and 80% of healthcare premiums for dependents. This starts from day one. We also offer at least 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents (up to 20 weeks for birthing parents), and generous vacation policies to give employees time to recharge when needed.

To build a clean and equitable energy future, we need everyone at the table. We strive to form a team as diverse as the communities we will serve with our technology, and are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply to our open jobs.


Show more

Are you ready to build America’s clean energy future with the team that will deliver? Form Energy is an American energy technology and manufacturing company. We are pioneering a new class of iron-air batteries to enable our electric grid to run on renewable, reliable, and affordable energy, every day of the year.

Form Energy has been recognized by TIME as “One of the Best Inventions of 2023” for its battery technology and by MIT Technology Review as a “Top Climate Tech Company to Watch”. We are making rapid progress on our mission of delivering energy storage for a better world, and are growing just as rapidly to meet demand. Our team has more than doubled in size in the past year, and continues to expand every day. We have signed contracts with leading electric utilities across the United States. Pilot production of our iron-air batteries has already begun, and later this year, production will take off to high volumes at our new factory in West Virginia.

Working for Form Energy is more than just a job, it’s a chance to be part of something extraordinary. And right now might be the most exciting moment in the company’s history to join. We are assembling a team of some of the most talented and motivated individuals across the country. Title: Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer
Description:
Required Skills


In-depth exposure to data quality concepts, best practices, and tools.
Experience in designing, developing and deploying business analytics dashboards using PowerBI.
Experience in Cloud Data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift.
Familiarity with Snowflake Data sharing, Snowpipe and Snowpark.
Experience in ETL tools such as Pentaho/Informatica and proficient in SQL.
Experience with Software as a Service cloud implementations particularly those in which legacy on premise applications have been migrated to cloud delivery options.


Additional Skills

Job DescriptionPosition Summary

The BEST Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer (DA/BI) will work with a Team comprised of BEST Program staff, agency business and technical SMEs and the new solution system integrator (SI) and product vendor to design and implement the data information management and reporting strategies, tools, and outputs to provide a robust reporting and data analytics capacity for users of the new Financials solution.The implementation of the new Financials solution will provide users with the ability to run queries and reports on the live data in this application directly rather than waiting for data to be available through warehouse reports. Data will be integrated across modules permitting more robust, real-time reporting and analytics capabilities.

The BEST Program Data Analyst/BI Engineer will work with the BEST Financials Data Lead to identify reporting, dashboard and business analytics needs that will drive the configuration of standard reports and dashboards delivered through the new Financials solution. The DA/BI Lead will assist in leading requirements sessions with BEST staff, agency staff and the system integrator and product vendor to review the reporting and analytics capabilities of the new solution and to identify available configuration options. The DA/BI Lead will develop and maintain a list of selected configurations for each report and dashboard and work with reports/dashboard developers during configuration to assist in translating business requirements to the configured reports. The DA/BI Lead will also participate in testing configured reports and dashboards and in organizing user testing of these items.

Whenever feasible, the BEST Program intends to adopt delivered reports and dashboards, but in instances where reporting requirements cannot be met by the delivered solutions, the DA/BI Lead will work with business and the system integrator and product vendor to identify requirements for future report development and participate in testing of these items when they are developed. The DA/BI Lead will work with business and the system integrator and product vendor to identify opportunities for improving the availability of data for reporting and analytics by understanding the solution’s capacities in this area, sharing that information with business and documenting implementation options with owners of other Commonwealth business intelligence and data analytics resources.

Financials

The DA/BI Lead will support data access for users in the following areas, working to improve data quality and access in the new solution:


Acquire to Retire (Capital Asset Management)
Cash Management
Cost Allocation
Debt Management
Grants Financial Management
Operating Budget Management
Order to Cash (Revenue/Accounts Receivable)
Procure to Pay (Accounts Payable)
Program Management
Record to Report (Financial Reporting)
Reporting/Analytics
Sub-fund Management
Vendor Management and Self Service


Operations


Maintenance and Warranty Management
Incident Management
Capacity Management
Availability Management
Performance Management
Security Management
Nightly Batch Jobs Management
Software Change Management and Testing
Disaster Recovery Testing and Management


Specific Duties


Contribute to the development of data reporting and data access through database queries, reports, and dashboards.
Gather information from agency business users and technical staff regarding the types of data, frequency of reports or dashboards, distribution of reports or dashboards, and other information as needed to understand the current reporting needs of agencies.
Participate in developing an approach to identifying reporting and data analytics needs across the new solution user community.
Document configuration decisions for each standard report and dashboard and provide guidance to report developers during the configuration stage.
Participate in testing of configured reports and dashboards and assist in coordinating user testing of these materials.
Support and manage enterprise architecture’s data operations (optimize data processing, query performance and data quality) and data pipelines.
Integrate data from diverse sources using ETL processes and transform raw data into datasets used for analysis.
Implement robust security measures, monitor data access and develop access policies.
Provide technological expertise to capture, store and employ data catalogue and lineage to support governance initiatives.
Understand business requirements in the BI context and design data models to convert raw data to meaningful insights.
Perform SQL, DAX queries and functions in Power BI.
Receive training and hands on guidance from the system integrator and product vendor in how to build queries, reports, and dashboards in order to assist reports developers in their work.
Assist in the creation of job aids and other training materials to support report writing by agency users.


Required Skills


Interviewing managers and other stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Interviewing users to understand what they need from data systems to boost their performance.
Translating business goals, user needs and process improvements into data management functions and requirements.
Explaining the capabilities of data systems to business managers and users as the new solution is designed and configured.
Providing guidance on project scoping to meet stakeholders' requirements.
Assessing whether data is fit for use by performing initial validation of data delivered as part of the project.
Exhibiting an excellent understanding of how data are used within business processes and its impact.
In-depth exposure to data quality concepts, best practices, and tools.
Experience in designing, developing and deploying business analytics dashboards using PowerBI.
Experience in Cloud Data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift.
Familiarity with Snowflake Data sharing, Snowpipe and Snowpark.
Experience in ETL tools such as Pentaho/Informatica and proficient in SQL.
Well-developed system analysis skills.
Understanding and knowledge of IT standards and controls.
Proficient written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.


Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Software as a Service cloud implementations particularly those in which legacy on premise applications have been migrated to cloud delivery options.

Minimum Entrance Requirements


Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 5 years of design and implementation experience in the areas of business intelligence/reporting and data warehousing.


Hybrid Work Model

Under this policy, employees are currently required to work a minimum of four business days per month (two set by management and two set by the employee) on-site at CTR’s Boston office and may work remotely the remainder of the time at a location approved by their supervisor, so long as they comply with the requirements of the telework policy. Under this policy, all employees must be able to report to the Boston office with little or no notice, even including the same workday should an exigent circumstance arise. Therefore, a reasonable proximity to the office is necessary. CTR does not reimburse for employees to travel to the office.

In addition, the successful candidate may be required to work primarily on site in Boston during the initial training and orientation period and/or for certain positions a primarily on-site role may be necessary.

Title: Technical Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in data analysis, data visualization, and data management. You will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making processes within the organization.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical methods to support data analysis.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to communicate data findings effectively.
Utilize tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or other visualization software to present data insights to stakeholders.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing data quality checks and validation processes.
Manage and maintain databases, including data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, marketing, finance, and operations, to understand data needs and deliver insights.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Utilize programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R to perform data analysis and automate processes.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analytics and technology.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field preferred.
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Data Analyst, Technical Analyst, or similar role.
Experience managing databases and leading ETL processes for clients in multiple fields.
Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure, including working with JSON and Azure SQL Database.
Experience with anti-fraud measures and certifications such as CTIA and R2.
Knowledge of business intelligence tools and creating interactive dashboards and data models.
Familiarity with project management tools such as Jira and Confluence, and frameworks like Hadoop and Spark.
Experience with scripting software to automate recurring tasks.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and Looker.
Familiarity with Airflow and DBT for data workflow management.
Experience with AGILE and SCRUM methodologies.
Strong background in providing quantitative and qualitative analysis for business standardization and process improvement.
Proven track record of using APM to increase communication and visibility within operations.
Demonstrated ability to apply process improvements and best practices using takt time analysis and standardized KPIs.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages.
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and statistical analysis.


As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

At Zelis, we champion diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in all aspects of our operations. We embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at Zelis, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Zelis is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, even if you do not believe you 100% fit the qualifications of the position, including women, LGBTQIA people, people of color, and people with disabilities.

Accessibility Support

We are dedicated to ensuring our application process is accessible to all candidates. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require a reasonable accommodation with any part of the application and/or interview process, please email TalentAcquisition@zelis.com

SCAM ALERT: There is an active nationwide employment scam which is now using Zelis to garner personal information or financial scams. This site is secure, and any applications made here are with our legitimate partner. If you’re contacted by a Zelis Recruiter, please ensure whomever is contacting you truly represents Zelis Healthcare. We will never asked for the exchange of any money or credit card details during the recruitment process. Please be aware of any suspicious email activity from people who could be pretending to be recruiters or senior professionals at Zelis.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst in Boston $65,000
Description:
Marketing Data Analyst in Boston! $65,000 +

Company Overview

Join us at ProPivotal, where data meets dynamism, and your career aspirations thrive! With a prestigious 28-year legacy, we have established ourselves as the premier choice for staffing solutions among mid-size organizations in the Boston area.

We provide temporary staffing, direct-hire staffing, managed staffing, and recruitment process outsourcing staffing. As a recognized leader in the staffing industry, ProPivotal is not just a workplace – it's a pathway to professional excellence.

Why Work at ProPivotal

At ProPivotal, we're pioneers of talent solutions! Our secret sauce? Deep-rooted relationships and tailor-made services that keep our clients coming back for more.

Team Spirit: Say goodbye to the isolation of remote work! At ProPivotal, you'll find yourself surrounded by a team that's not just colleagues but companions in your professional journey. Together, we celebrate victories, overcome challenges, and forge bonds that last a lifetime.

Transparent Leadership: Our management team isn't just at the helm; they're alongside you, guiding, supporting, and empowering you every step of the way. Experience the transparency, integrity, and dedication of ProPivotal's leadership firsthand.

Unparalleled Training: At ProPivotal, learning never stops. We offer personalized support and invest in your growth. Get ready to earn your stripes with the Certified Staffing Professional Certificate from the American Staffing Association, backed by ProPivotal's unwavering support.

15 Years of Excellence: ProPivotal's commitment to excellence is not just a promise; it's a legacy. With 15 consecutive years of winning the Best of Staffing industry award, we set the benchmark for excellence in the staffing realm.

Marketing Data Analyst Responsibilities

As a Marketing Data Analyst at ProPivotal, you'll be at the forefront of our data-driven revolution. Dive deep into candidate applications, harness the power of data analytics, and unlock the full potential of candidate leads. Your responsibilities will include:


Interpreting data to optimize candidate utilization.
Crafting search parameters to match candidates with client job openings.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to address business needs.
Delivering insightful reports and presentations to senior management.


Who We're Looking For


Experience: Bring at least 3 years of related experience in a corporate environment to the table, with exposure to talent acquisition being a definite plus.
Analytical Acumen: Demonstrate a keen interest in analysis, with familiarity in tools like R or Python considered advantageous.
Critical Thinking: Possess superior critical thinking and analytical skills, coupled with an impeccable attention to detail.
Location:. Do you want to work in person in our Boston office. Our approach (100% in-office) is an important facilitator of staff development. We typically employ professionals who have an easy commute to our Boston Office (located near South Station).
Team Player: Enjoy and contribute to a positive team environment. We want someone who gets along with a variety of people/personalities and someone who can positively impact the work environment of peers, direct reports, leadership, and all employees. In plain English, someone who is free of drama and a pleasure to work with in good times and bad.


Join ProPivotal: We celebrate uniqueness and welcome everyone to the table, ProPivotal is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, color, religion, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor. #pando3-2

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance - REMOTE
Description:
Put your Insurance Experience to work - FROM HOME!

At WAHVE we value significant insurance experience and want to revolutionize the way people think about phasing into retirement by offering qualified candidates the opportunity to continue their career working from home. As we say - retire from the office but not from work. Our unique platform provides you with real work/life balance and allows you to customize your own work schedule while continuing to utilize your insurance expertise in a remote, long-term position which includes company benefits!

What You’ll Love About Wahve

We created a welcoming place to work with friendly and professional leadership. We are known for the great care we take with our staff and our clients. We are passionate and determined about delivering the best customer service, preserving insurance industry knowledge, and making a difference by the work that we do.

What We Are Seeking

We have assignments available to help our insurance industry clients in Data Analyst positions. Responsibilities include:


Build and maintain data warehouse, new reports, and ad hoc reports.
Work with user groups to identify reporting issues/enhancements and document business requirements.
Will serve as a member of a project team and/or work independently on projects.
Support and train internal users as needed.
Compile and prepare data for customer analysis.
Experience in C#, Visual Studio, JavaScript, CSS, and current web technologies such as .NET, ASP, JSON, and XML.
Experience with ANY of the following technologies: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SSIS Reporting, Power BI, Dynamics CRM, Dynamics GP, Share point, Excel, Power Query, Power Pivot.
Ability to compile data results and author commentary on industry studies is a plus.
Insurance or financial services industry experience required.


TO BECOME A WORK-AT-HOME VINTAGE EXPERT, WE REQUIRE


25 years of full-time work experience
Experience working in a data analysis role in the insurance or financial services industry - required


Benefits Of Becoming a Wahve Vintage Expert


Health insurance based on eligibility.
401(k) with a 4% match.
Retire from the office but not from work.
Eliminate the office stress and the commute.
Choose the work you would like to do now.
Customize your schedule - full or part time.
Utilize your years of insurance industry knowledge.
Be part of our dynamic yet virtual team environment and connect with other experienced insurance professionals like yourself!


How To Get Started

Click APPLY NOW to complete our simple preliminary profile. Be sure to include your preferred contact information as one of our Qualification Specialists will connect with you promptly.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Title: Data Analyst/Engineer - Junior/Entry
Description:
Since 2010 Synergisticit has helped Jobseekers get employed in the tech Job market by providing candidates the requisite skills, experience, and technical competence to outperform at interviews and clients. Here at SynergisticIT We just don't focus on getting you a tech Job we make careers.

In this Job market also, our candidates can achieve multiple job offers and $100k + salaries.

All Positions are open for all visas and US citizens

We at Synergistic understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped 1000's of candidates get jobs at technology clients like Apple, google, Paypal, Western Union, Client, visa, Walmart labs etc to name a few.

Currently, We are looking for entry-level software programmers, Java full-stack developers, Python/Java developers, Data analysts/ Data Scientists, and Machine Learning engineers for full-time positions with clients.

Who Should Apply Recent Computer Science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates or People looking to switch careers or who have had gaps in employment and are looking to make their careers in the Tech Industry.

We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates

We want Data Science/Machine learning/Data Analyst and Java Full stack candidates

For data Science/Machine learning Positions

Required Skills

Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT

Project work on the technologies needed

Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive

Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle

Knowledge of Statistics, Gen AI, LLM, Python, Computer Vision, data visualization tools

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred skills: NLP, Text mining, Tableau, PowerBI, Databricks, Tensorflow

REQUIRED SKILLS For Java /Full Stack/Software Positions

Bachelors degree or Masters degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT

Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive

Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle

Project work on the skills

Knowledge of Core Java, Javascript, C++, or software programming

Spring boot, Microservices, Docker, Jenkins, Github, Kubernetes, and REST API experience

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

If you get emails from our Job Placement team and are not interested please email them or ask them to take you off their distribution list and make you unavailable as they share the same database with the client servicing team and only connect with candidates who match client requirements.

No phone calls, please. Shortlisted candidates would be reached out. No third-party or agency candidates or C2C candidates

Title: Survey Analyst/Data Entry
Description:
ERG is a research and consulting firm that provides a wide range of support to federal, state, and commercial clients. ERG offers multidisciplinary teams with nationally recognized skills in engineering, science, economics, public health, informational technology, and communications. We hire people with the best minds and then provide them with a vibrant and flexible environment in which to develop their careers. The qualified individual must be highly motivated with the skills to prioritize, perform, and communicate effectively in a fast-paced environment. 




Eastern Research Group, Inc. (ERG) is seeking survey analysts to join our team in providing a range of services related to survey data collection and verification. The work will primarily be for the Department of Labor (DOL), Wage and Hour Division (WHD). DOL WHD directs and coordinates the determination of prevailing wage rates under the Davis-Bacon Act. Survey analysts will help collect, review, and validate data submitted in response to the wage rate data gathering efforts targeted at the construction industry. The work will involve data entry, cleaning, and verification, answering a telephone/email helpline, and performing quality control/quality assurance activities. 




Job Description:
Members of the team collecting, reviewing, and validating data in response to the wage rate data-gathering efforts targeted at the construction industry
Data entry, cleaning, and verification
Answer a telephone/email helpline to assist survey respondents
Perform quality control/quality assurance activities
Participate in additional projects for the Davis-Bacon Act as requested





Qualifications and Skills:
At least an associate degree
Self-motivated
Detail-oriented
Ability to familiarize with numerous protocols and think critically about when/how to apply them
Data cleaning experience, customer service, and familiarity with Microsoft Excel is desirable
Ability to obtain low-level security clearance








ERG offers competitive salaries and excellent benefits, including health and dental insurance, life insurance, long-term disability, educational benefits, FSAs, a generous 401k plan, profit sharing, an EAP, 11-20 paid vacation days per year, 10 paid holidays per year, 56 hours or more of sick leave (based on the state you work in) per year (pro-rated for part-time) and more. The salary range for all positions depends on the years and type of experience.

 

ERG is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable EEOC and affirmative action regulations. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. As such, successful candidates must be committed to working with diverse and inclusive teams.

  

Please be aware, the only authentic corporate domain for ERG is https://www.erg.com.  ERG may, on occasion, screen applicants via telephone or video interviews via Skype, Teams, GoToMeeting, or another type of video platform. However, any candidate extended a job offer might be asked to meet in person with an ERG employee before providing confidential personal information associated with new employment.

 

If you’re a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ERG’s online application process as a result of your disability. To request accommodation, please contact Human Resources via email at Resumes-Lex@erg.com or call (781) 674-7293.

 

As ERG is a friendly, flexible, inclusive environment and has clients who are committed to making the world a better place, ERGers are incredibly dedicated. We promote and recognize principles of fairness, equity, and social justice in the work we do, the partnerships we foster, and the culture we value both within and outside of our organization.

Show more

Title: Junior Power BI Data Analyst - Contract
Description:
Junior Power BI Data Analyst
Framingham, MA, Hybrid (2 days in office) If needed (Remote)
3 Month Contract with potential extension
36.25 hours a week

Looking for a junior level data analyst with 3-5 years of exp and exp with Power BI - will be moving reports over into Power BI....

Recognize business requirements in the context of BI and create data models to transform raw data into relevant insights
Using Power BI, create dashboards and interactive visual reports
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) with specific objectives and track them regularly
Analyze data and display it in reports to aid decision-making
Convert business needs into technical specifications and establish a timetable for job completion
Create, test, and deploy Power BI scripts, as well as execute efficient deep analysis
Construct a data warehouse
Use SQL queries to get the best results
Make technological adjustments to current BI systems to improve their performance
For a better understanding of the data, use filters and visualization
